meanings.definition: Marquesses: plural noun, a nobleman ranking above an earl and below a duke.
meanings.sent1: The marquesses in the kingdom were known for their elegant attire.
meanings.sent2: The king invited the marquesses to the royal banquet.
meanings.sent3: The marquesses decided to have a friendly race to see who was the fastest nobleman.
meanings.sent4: Among the nobility, the marquesses stood out like shining stars.
meanings.sent5: The grand hall was filled with the laughter of the marquesses.

meanings.definition: Marquesses: verb, third person singular present, to create or appoint as a marquess.
meanings.sent1: The king marquesses his loyal subjects for their unwavering support.
meanings.sent2: She marquesses her most trusted advisor as the new chancellor.
meanings.sent3: The fairy godmother marquesses Cinderella as the belle of the ball.
meanings.sent4: The artist marquesses the protagonist of his painting with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The wizard marquesses the humble farmer as the chosen one to defeat the dragon.
